gameview.kIView

Class KIHardBrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameview.kIView.AKIBrain
      • gameview.kIView.KIHardBrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class KIHardBrain
extends AKIBrain
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The Brain of the hard KI, does all stuff required to do a good move i the game.
    Version:
    4.0.0
    Author:
    Jasper S.

      • bfsAllThiefs

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> bfsAllThiefs(java.lang.String from,
                                            java.util.Set<java.lang.String> set,
                                            int depth)
                                              throws NoPathFoundException
        This method is an easy BFS, it scan's the Map for the shortest way, regardless which Tickets are used. This is only limited by the depth, which should be the amout of all tickets a figure has.
        Parameters:
        from - from where?
        set - the targetedPositions
        depth - maximal depth
        Returns:
        a sorted LinkedList with the shortest way on the map
        Throws:
        NoPathFoundException - If there is no Path from 'from' to 'to' this exception is thrown
        Since:
        2.9

      • filterNewBFSAllThiefs

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> filterNewBFSAllThiefs(java.lang.String targetPosition,
                                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> paths,
                                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> visited)
        Filter the results of the search to get a linkedList with the shortest move.
        Parameters:
        targetPosition - the position desired
        paths - the paths Map from BFSAllThiefs
        visited - the links visited
        Returns:
        the desired path

      • processNewBFSResults

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Move> processNewBFSResults(java.util.List<java.lang.String> path,
                                                        EInitNewGame figureData)
                                                           throws NoPathFoundException
        take the filtered path data and join it with ticketinformations resulting in a map with a position as key and a move as value
        Parameters:
        path - the pathlist from filterNewBFSAllThiefs
        figureData - the figure data
        Returns:
        BFS result as map
        Throws:
        NoPathFoundException - whenever the figure does not have enough tickets to go the way

      • computePoliceMove

        private void computePoliceMove(ENextFigure e)
        Compute the move of a police figure We know this method has 84 lines of code and therefore 44 lines of code too much. But due to it's total awesomeness we left it like it is. It's possimpible.
        Parameters:
        e - the ENextFigure event with all data needed

      • computeThiefMove

        private void computeThiefMove(ENextFigure e)
        This method is used to compute a thief move * We know this method has 79 lines of code and therefore 44 lines of code too much. But due to it's total awesomeness we left it like it is. It's possimpible.
        Parameters:
        e - the ENextFigure event with all relevant and fresh data.
